alert.note: Alert for Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:30PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Malheur County through 415 PM PDT... At 330 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arock to near Three Man Butte. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Danner, Scott Reservoir and Antelope Reservoir around 440 PM MDT. Little Grassy Reservoir, Little Grassy Mountain, Basque Station and Bowden Hills around 450 PM MDT. Mustang Butte and Overshoe Pass around 500 PM MDT. Schoolhouse Hill around 410 PM PDT. Castro Ridge, Grassy Mountain and Mouse Trap Butte around 510 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
